programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Special episode revisiting the bidders' most uproarious feuds.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A one-of-a-kind Star Wars Boba Fett prototype action figure jetpacks into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether Rick will pay the bounty.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gives a limited edition 2014 Hertz Penske GT Mustang a test drive around the Las Vegas Motor Speedway.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick takes on a huge challenge when a giant slide from the 1960s shaped like a rocket is brought into the shop a piece at a time.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The abduction of a university student from a friend's home in the middle of the night, a crime that left the people of Reno, Nevada, in fear of who might be next.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: If I Were a Tibetin' Man
programme.desc: The bidders compete for a potentially profitable furniture locker, while Ricky and Bubba buy a collection of American football autographs, but need to check if they are genuine.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa finds looking for fine art and designer furniture too stressful to cope with, and Roy thinks a theme park brochure from the 1970s will make him a profit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.sub-title: A Photo a Tooth the Truth?
programme.desc: Two potentially game-changing discoveries are made in the Ozarks as the investigation into whether giant humanoids ever roamed America continues.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFOs are the biggest mystery of the age, yet somebody - or something - seems determined to keep it that way. This documentary seeks to assess why that may be the case.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining why different cultures have similar tales of monsters and giants, and questioning whether they could be genuine eye-witness accounts of extraterrestrials.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team repair a 1960s popcorn machine, and a client brings in an antique air compressor.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: While Rick is away, his brother Ron takes matters into his own hands when a client brings in a 1900s love tester. Is this a match made in overhaul heaven?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed picture of John Belushi and a Jim Henson puppet arrive in the shop, but it remains to be seen if any of them are worth big money.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Nepalese Bira gun from the late 1800s arrives in the shop, and a 1970s Bob Peak TWA mural makes a big impression.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The PA Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: The bidders attend a series of auctions in the southern Californian city of Rancho Cucamonga.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers attend a locker auction in Orange County, where Ivy Calvin ends up having to dig through a pile of rubbish.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A famous cowboy offers his assistance to the bidders at an auction in Fort Worth, while Lesa finds a means to triumph over her rival.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: One of the buyers accidentally acquires a historically important item, while Victor gets his hands on an intriguing locked treasure chest - with no key.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four competitors create weld blades from tiny cubes of steel, then two smiths forge a German Zweihander and one will be crowned Forged in Fire Champion.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Jim and Bill Vieira track promising leads on the Goshen Mystery Tunnel site, and a giant skeleton found in 1849.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Area 51 is considered the ultimate top secret facility, but there is another military site, known as Area 52, where strange phenomena have been witnessed for 10 years.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Places on Earth where aliens may have landed in ancient times, from Mexico's Zone of Silence to the Markawasi Plateau in Peru.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod realise they will have to pool their resources with Barry if they are to stand any chance of making a profit at an auction in San Jacinto.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, where Darrell made the most profitable purchase in the show's history.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A hand-painted, signed guitar from Def Leppard's Phil Collen rocks into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed platinum disc from glam metal band Poison has Rick wondering whether it is worth adding to his record collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit some of the most expensive items in the shop as Pawn Stars splash the cash for a 1961 Fender Stratocaster guitar, Mickey Mouse display items, and a Star Wars collection..

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange objects above Sweden, a UFO over Portugal and an extraordinary 'mass-sighting' of strange luminous phenomena in a remote Italian village.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The PA Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: The bidders attend a series of auctions in the southern Californian city of Rancho Cucamonga.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers attend a locker auction in Orange County, where Ivy Calvin ends up having to dig through a pile of rubbish.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topics of love and loveliness. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are stand-up and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe, Irish actress and comedienne Aisling Bea and author and comedian Tony Hawks.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Desiree Burch, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Glenn Moore. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and stand-up comedians Bill Bailey and Jason Manford join regular panellist Alan Davies for another round of the comedy quiz with a difference. Host Stephen Fry continues this series' exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about lethal things.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topics of love and loveliness. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are stand-up and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe, Irish actress and comedienne Aisling Bea and author and comedian Tony Hawks.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray test their general knowledge skills in more trivia-based games.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, featuring a hard-hitting mixture of body and observational footage, which reflect the daily challenges of combating crime and offer fresh insights into the fast-paced world of modern policing.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for iconic items that are as American as apple pie and baseball.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori team up with Jesse McClure, but they are not sure he can be trusted.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori Bernier discover more potential bargains in storage lockers, including a trio of motorhomes, bronze statues and jet skis.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a classic 33 Ford that has been sitting so long that a tree has grown around it, but nothing stops the guys from rescuing this rare ride.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a mineshaft that leads to an underground saloon, where they find treasures including folk art, brass car parts and motorbikes.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve agrees to build a crazy 1970s-era gasser racecar for a US Navy veteran and tries to make money by restoring and flipping a Prohibition-era bootlegger Model A truck.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three hosts are each given a budget of Â£5,000 to find a car that can hold its own on a racetrack and handle everyday tasks, before testing their purchases in Germany. James May puts two Porsches through their paces on the Top Gear test circuit, and former Downing Street communications director Alastair Campbell tries out the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Chaos ensues on the Saturday night shift in Stoke-on-Trent, while Rich makes a disturbing discovery in Uttoxeter. Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve commits to the original build time to deliver the Villain Rat Rod in three weeks. With no sign of a transmission, it doesn't look like the crew will meet their deadline.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters search for the world's best four-seat supercar, pitting the Aston Martin Rapide against the Porsche Panamera Turbo and Maserati Quattroporte in a series of unusual challenges in the south of England. Harry Potter star Rupert Grint and ex-Formula One driver Rubens Barrichello each do a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car and Richard Hammond puts the Chevrolet Camaro SS and Mercedes E63 AMG through their paces on the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own versions of motorhomes and set off for a bank holiday weekend in the West Country to try out their creations in the real world. The Audi R8 V10 Spyder also takes on the Porsche 911 Turbo Cabriolet on the test track, and American actor Andy Garcia does a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Jan Ravens and Grayson Perry join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the unconventional quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists learn some tricks with eggs, meet a flying pig and join in as the studio audience sings along with Western film themes. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray continue to test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-up star David O'Doherty, Pointless co-host Richard Osman, comedienne Susan Calman and weather presenter Carol Kirkwood join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-ups Sarah Millican and Jon Richardson, actor David Harewood and comic Bob Mortimer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Gina Yashere, Sam Simmons, Ellie Taylor
programme.desc: Award-winning funnywoman Gina Yashere introduces surreal Australian comedian Sam Simmons and rising comedy star Ellie Taylor to the stage in a gig recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Thomas struggles with the definition of a mammal, Iain Stirling devises an explosive chemistry experiment and Sian Gibson sends an NSFW text to Greg.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of ladies and gents. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are stand-up comedian Ross Noble, Australian author Kathy Lette and comedienne and Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of liars and lying. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedienne Sara Pascoe, Bad Education and Fresh Meat star Jack Whitehall, and stand-up and The Last Leg host Adam Hills.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians reveal how the railways transformed the British diet, rescuing a nation that was struggling to feed itself. Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn discover how the mass transportation of livestock gave birth to the traditional British roast, and Ruth Goodman is in Whitby, which became a thriving fishing town thanks to the North Yorkshire Moors Railway supplying its kippers. Plus, Hampshire's watercress line, which brought nutritional salad to the masses, and how the use of steam-powered engines revolutionised production at Britain's oldest brewery.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Portugal to meet leading experts on the Three Secrets of Fatima - a series of visions and prophecies allegedly given by the Virgin Mary to three young shepherds in 1917.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to France to explore the possibility that Jesus married Mary Magdalene, and they had children. He meets respected scholars, authors and historians to consider the theory the son of God's bloodline lives on today.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A multi-billion-pound 32km super sewer under the streets of London, an early sewer system at the Palace of Knossos and a pivotal piece of tunnel boring equipment from the past.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective investigates a failed rape attempt by a masked attacker known as the Bowman. However, his job is complicated when the victim commits suicide and the criminal strikes again. Glasgow-set detective drama, with Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The net starts to tighten around Ralph Saroyan when more is discovered about his secret financial dealings. Meanwhile, Evie's affair with Treasury Minister Lord Montford threatens the future of the company, and Bea's marriage continues to flounder.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy says farewell to the Fusiliers. Complications during a live firing exercise results in a secret coming up to the surface. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kerry does a disappearing act, leading to speculation that David Radford may have made good on his vow to kill her - although the gangster isn't the only one with a vested interest in ensuring her silence. Smithy eventually discovers the wayward PC by her father's hospital bed and declares his love - but their chances of romance are cut cruelly short when she is struck by a sniper's bullet while returning to Sun Hill station with earth-shattering news.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess follows Zubin to Paris, in an attempt to resolve the problems in their relationship once and for all. Her father is also in the city with Donna, in response to a request from a patient who has insisted on seeing a French cancer specialist. However, Ric soon has worries of his own when he gambles all his money away. Back in Britain, Will tries to rush through his shift so he can get home to his children, which proves fatal for a patient.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Kate, Lorna, Andy and Nick gather at Trevor's bedside as his condition worsens. A blood-splattered elderly woman appears in A&E, with no apparent injuries to herself and an inability to discuss the events that have befallen her. A 14-year-old girl is admitted with severe stomach cramps, while Mike finalises plans to return to South Africa.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. After Kerry tragically loses her fight for life, Gabriel sets about covering his tracks by disposing of forensic evidence and intimidating a witness - but a shocking revelation could shatter his cold-blooded demeanour. Stunned by Kerry's death, a grief-crazed Smithy lashes out at Adam, swears revenge on David Radford and hands in his resignation to Gina, while DI Morrell resolves to track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Romance is in the air for Phil when the Mitchells go out on a stag night. Pat gets an urgent call for help. Frank panics about finances, while Pete comes to Sam and Ricky's rescue.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: All Arthur wants is to give Pauline a birthday treat, but his efforts are hampered by a well-meaning family.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Hallam and Tate argue over sending reinforcements in search of missing people after a building collapses. Meanwhile, Charisma learns the truth about Donna.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer tries to beat Charlie Gimbert to a priceless collection of Jewish antiques that has turned up in Essex. Alfred Marks guest stars with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim protects a prestigious Arab visitor staying with Charlie, but is concerned by the number of accidents befalling him. Nadim Sawalha guest stars, with John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The Boswell family try to cope without Nellie, who has some surprise visitors - her 'fancy man' Derek and Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Captain Peacock's wife is hired as Mr Rumbold's secretary, and he becomes convinced the two are having an adulterous liaison. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Nicholas Smith and Diana King.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer but Only Part-Time
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The inspector and his ambitious sergeant John Bacchus investigate the murder of Dolores Kenny, a black woman. She is a regular attender of a local club's soul all-nighters, events popular with factory workers from across the racial divide. Gently begins to uncover evidence of prejudice within the local community and his own police force as he seeks to identify the victim's killer. Detective drama set in 1968, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Lenora Crichlow, Craig Conway, Pippa Bennett-Warner and Maggie O'Neill.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The discovery of a charred corpse in a disused railway tunnel sets Taggart on the gruesome hunt for a ruthless killer in an investigation with sinister undertones of black magic and voodoo. In an another twist, the wife of an arthritic dentist narrowly escapes a series of murder attempts, adding to a complex case for Taggart and his team. Starring Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson, and featuring a guest appearance by Annette Crosbie.

programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan brings perspective to the day's national and international news, with in-depth reporting, interviews, analysis from our specialist correspondents and lively debate.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Ross Kemp and the Armed Police
programme.desc: In a follow-up documentary to last year's Ross Kemp and the Armed Police, the actor and film-maker follows tactical firearms units to investigate whether all police in the UK will one day be armed. With armed officers now a more regular presence on Britain's streets - in train stations and at airports - Ross goes out on a raid with a mobile undercover unit used to tackle new dangers with pre-emptive and confrontational tactics. He also gains access to their military-style training facility.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tests the contestants' knife skills, tasking them to core and slice apples, then gives them 10 minutes to debone pork loin to turn it into four pork steaks. The final task is to create the perfect pork dish and, once the challenges are over, the three best finalists press on for the coveted title and cash prize. Presented by Fern Britton.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Studio courtroom show in which criminal barrister Robert Rinder rules on real life cases.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Leeds, where James Layte is captivated by a snapshot of a man's military past, and Helen Gardiner comes across a walking stick.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, in which a family of five answer questions about top 10 lists then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Will they have what it takes to head home with the Â£125,000 cash?.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Liz, Tariq, Sue and Tom pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity sees red, Matty worries about what Moira is up to, and Sarah feels conflicted.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz gets caught breaking the rules, while Chesney and Gemma take the quads to a glamorous photo shoot. Elsewhere, Leanne learns of Tracy's secret fling, but it remains to be seen whether she tells Steve.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together, beginning their journey in Florida, the southernmost point of the country. From there, the pair head to the Palm Beach International Raceway, before getting up close and personal with sharks.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz and Tyrone are questioned about the Christmas Day shootings. Meanwhile, Dev orders Chesney to make a choice, and Tracy's explanation shocks Leanne.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. In the early hours of August 7th 1985, Nevill and June Bamber were shot and killed inside their farmhouse, along with their adoptive daughter, Sheila Caffell, and Sheila's six-year-old twin sons, Daniel and Nicholas Caffell. Police receive a call from the only surviving member of June and Nevill's immediate family, their adoptive son Jeremy. At first, it appears to be an open-and-shut case to investigating officer DCI Thomas 'Taff' Jones, but for DS Stan Jones, something does not feel right.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Timothy West joins the host to look back on a five-decade career as one of Britain's best-loved actors. The former EastEnders star speaks candidly about his 52-year marriage to Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales, and the impact of her battle with dementia on their lives. He also reveals the trauma of his first wife's mental health problems, and how he finally made peace with his daughter after several years of estrangement. On a lighter note, Timothy also reflects on his role at the wedding of Prince Charles and Camilla Parker-Bowles, and the time he toured the set of Coronation Street - disguised as former Soviet president Mikhail Gorbachev.

programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating St Petersburg Metro, Civet coffee and chip-makers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera

programme.desc: Amazing tales of human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures - all caught on camera.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Panicked Paraglider, Shocking Safari, Runaway Rocket
programme.desc: Hair-raising home-video footage demonstrates what can happen if a paraglider fails to maintain composure. Plus a shocking safari incident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A massive explosion hits an oil storage depot, and in Canada a bull ends a rodeo rider's career. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A sheikh in Qatar escapes when his race boat flips in the Persian Gulf, and a seaplane crashes during take-off only feet away from an amateur cameraman. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: Torrential rain threatens production, and the rookie drivers are not pulling their weight. Then, disaster strikes when harvester Kevin Cummings flips his machine.

programme.title: Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Highlights of day four from indigo at the O2 in London.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating radars. Plus, the production of pistachios.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Upholsterer Craig is tested to his limit by an Edwardian sofa ruined by an amateur repair job. Plus, lighting restorer Jolene tackles an original Second World War bomber lamp.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove continue their search through Britain's sheds in search of vintage treasure to restore and sell for a tidy profit. In Surrey, they find Pontiac ambulances, mysterious automotive sculptures and strangely well-preserved motorbikes.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove are off to Cornwall. They meet a collector whose cottage is like a transport museum, chock-full with memorabilia, penny farthings and lights of all description - watched over by Buster, the guard rabbit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to buy a rare German Hetzer tank from Russian oligarch Slava, who will need some persuading.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Matt Adams gets himself into trouble as he transports a bull, while the Kendalls share an experience as a family.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes to France in search of a retro Citroen HY Van, but mechanic Edd China is not impressed with his spoils, knowing it will be a costly renovation.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage driver Tom leads a convoy of three Giant Dumper Trucks, each weighing 77 tonnes and worth a million pounds, on an epic 680km journey from Somerset to Derbyshire.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson investigates rumours of secret underground escape route used by infamous gangster Al Capone. Plus, mysterious earthen mounds in Washington State.

programme.title: Live Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day five from indigo at the O2 in London.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Matt Adams faces a rough ride, the Stephens brothers battle bogs to rescue their haul and Macca McReady runs into trouble with a valuable load.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a BMW Isetta bubble car, but Edd China finds the small vehicle difficult to repair and the pair's chances of turning a profit are put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Cabinet maker Alex repairs a battered chest that once belonged to a secretive Masonic lodge. Blacksmith Nev uses his skills to restore some historic street lamps.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard embarks on a road trip, travelling to Norfolk, Pembroke and Essex. In Pembroke, he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Metal worker Dominic Chinea has to use all of his restoration skills to future proof an old, Cornish museum sign, while Steven Fletcher has to steer an old banger back onto the road. Plus, bear-care team Julie and Amanda start treatment on George, a very special teddy who has lost one of his eyes and his growl.

programme.title: Carabao Cup on Quest
programme.desc: Match highlights of all the action from the Carabao Cup.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Bureau agents track down seven dangerous criminals who have escaped from a Texas prison, robbed a store and killed a policeman.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary featuring investigations in which natural clues, including insect bites, cat hair and a rare form of bacteria helped forensic scientists solve murders.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The previously untold real-life copycat crimes and criminals inspired by blockbuster movies and TV shows. This instalment focuses on the undue influence of the movie Heathers.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Walsenburg, Colorado, in which a frantic emergency telephone call to help a neighbour ended in a bizarre investigation, complete with a twisted tale of torture and family secrets.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Operation Shattered Shield, an undercover investigation to root out corruption in the New Orleans Police Department.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Neglected parrots are rescued from an abandoned house, and a trapped cat is helped out of a tight spot. Plus, advice on tackling a wild raccoon.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown helps a cuckoo with an injured leg, rescues two dogs from a rooftop, examines a golden retriever, and checks a koala's eyesight.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a racehorse to see if it can join the unwanted thoroughbred programme. Plus, a dog hit by a car, and a kitten with earache receive attention.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer faces a dilemma, and a bride's friends are not sure what to make of her over-the-top dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Three brides, whose weddings are a celebration of life as well as love. Cheryl and Krisin have recently beaten cancer, and Jennifer is battling kidney disease.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori wonders if she needs to break out her sage to please superstitious brides.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr. Peter performs risky surgery on a guinea pig. Plus, a German Shepherd is rushed into the clinic with suspected paralysis from a tick and a snake needs specialist help. S1/5/10

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a young foal with a dislocated knee, after which every second counts as the team executes a seizure warrant and rushes it back.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated mare is rescued, and animal protection officers seize two Great Danes that were left home alone.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with designer Rupert Blanchard and woodworking expert Norman Wilkinson helping her transform them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An insight into how the latest techniques helped to find the murderer of a mother-of-two whose body was found 20 years earlier.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The discovery and identification of a human skull found in a Texas canyon with a single red hair, which led police to launch a manhunt when it was reconstructed.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Hatice Corbacioglu, who vanished in June 2009 while visiting lover Riza Cosa in New York. The plot thickened when Cosa fled to his native Turkey and the body of his wife was was found stuffed in a bag in a New York steel factory where he had worked. A year later, in an apparent suicide, Cosa fell to his death from a tall building,.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein examine the case against Alfred Moore, who was sentenced to death for murdering two policemen in Huddersfield in 1951.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Eager grooms accompany their fiancees on the hunt for dresses, and a former customer receives sad news when her engagement is broken off.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The consultants face a trying situation when a socialite comes in to collect a $20,000 dress she designed herself, only to have second thoughts about it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kate finds herself torn between two dresses when she visits the store to pick out something special for her renewal ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The brutally honest assessment of her twin sister leaves future bride Vicky struggling to pick a gown, while a mother and daughter come in for a double fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A different trio takes charge of the sales floor, but not everyone agrees that change is a good thing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The crew meets a celebrity designer and a bride-to-be who wants a wedding dress painted on her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: How some brides struggle to find the perfect dress, and their idea of a perfect wedding can be put in doubt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be brings scorecards to rate her gowns, while another has her first fitting. Plus, the annual Blowout Sale begins.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits Leominster, Herefordshire, where he takes in a very special private garden, and tours one of the country's last remaining brass foundries.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with designer Rupert Blanchard and woodworking expert Norman Wilkinson helping her transform them.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Since his mother died, Aaron has had to support his father. However, he struggles with food addiction and must care for himself to avoid eating himself to an early grave.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: A woman enlists Lisa Joyner's help as she tries to track down her birth mother. However, in the process they unearth a secret that has remained hidden for 40 years.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Born with No Eyes: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A four-year-old Brazilian boy who was born without eyes is fitted with a hand-crafted prosthetic.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Agents search for a nurse whose car has been found abandoned, and suspect one of her neighbours may have been involved in her disappearance.
